trans:
Hello,
Here are a few explanations about collective heating ğŸ™‚
Your heater's temperature varies with the outside temperature.
If you don't feel any heat coming from your heater, this doesn't mean that it's faulty. In mid-season, the heating may stop because it's warm enough, or it may be lukewarm because you don't need to heat much to reach the required temperature of 19Â°C.
There are three situations throughout the year:
Spring and summer
When temperatures start to go back up and the minimum temperature is above 15Â°C, the heaters are switched off. We'll let you know when the heating is switched off.
